maize_details.description: Maize, commonly known as corn, is a cereal grain that originated in Mesoamerica and is now cultivated worldwide. It is a staple food for many cultures and has various uses.
maize_details.nutritional value: Maize is rich in carbohydrates, dietary fiber, vitamins, and minerals. It provides energy, supports digestive health, and contains antioxidants.
maize_details.uses: Human consumption (whole kernels, flour, cornmeal), Livestock feed, Ethanol production, Industrial uses (cornstarch, corn syrup)
maize_details.varieties: Sweet corn, Field corn, Flint corn, Dent corn, Popcorn

prerequisites.soil: Maize grows best in well-drained, fertile soils with good moisture retention.
prerequisites.climate: Maize requires warm temperatures with a growing season of 60 to 100 frost-free days, and consistent moisture during critical growth stages.
prerequisites.sunlight: Maize needs full sunlight for optimal growth and development.
prerequisites.water: Regular watering, especially during the growing season and tasseling/silking stage.
prerequisites.space: Plant maize seeds about 1 to 2 inches deep and 8 to 12 inches apart in rows spaced 24 to 36 inches apart.
